FHIR Diagnostic Report -- JSON to HTML

Example of an FHIR Diagnostic Report from JSON response to React Component

FHIR Diagnostic Report for an Ultrasound

  • Example of a single patient record of type DiagnosticReport
  • NOTE Line 6: Under the property text there is a child prop called div -- this is a JSON string which can be parsed to HTML for easy viewing of the record.
{

  "id": "ultrasound",

Parse JSON with React Component

Actual React Component in the Health Demo

  • Lines: 17-22: This will be replaced with an GraphQL Query to our Discovery Service
  • Lines: 42: FHIR Diagnostic Report JSON is parsed in a React Component
import * as React from 'react'
import _ from 'lodash'
import ReactHtmlParser from 'react-html-parser'

// These imports represents medical records retrieved by your API call
import ReportBloodExam from 'components/DiagnosticReports/diagnosticreport-example-f001-bloodexam'
import ReportPgx from 'components/DiagnosticReports/diagnosticreport-example-pgx'
import ReportUltraSound from 'components/DiagnosticReports/diagnosticreport-example-ultrasound'

const SimpleDiagnosticReports = ({...props}) => {
  const {...prop} = props
  const patientInfo = prop.patientInfo
  
  const getDiagnosticReports = (patient_info) => {
    const records = []

    // TODO: Add API Call to fetch medical records based on patient_info
    const fhirMedicalRecords = [
      ReportBloodExam, 
      ReportPgx,
      ReportUltraSound
    ]

    // Create Array of FHIR records with resource type "DiagnosticReport"
    _.each(fhirMedicalRecords, (obj) => {
      if (obj.resourceType === 'DiagnosticReport') {
        records.push({
          id: obj.id,
          subject: obj.subject.reference,
          title: obj.code.text,
          html: obj.text.div,
        })
      }
    })

    // Render list of records by parsing the JSON string
    const _records = records.map((obj) => {
      let jsObj = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(obj))
      return (
        <div className={'p24 mb48 bg-white'}>
          <h3 className={'p12 bg-gray'}>{obj.title}</h3>
          {ReactHtmlParser(jsObj.html)}
        </div>
      )
    })
    return _records
  }

  return (
    <section className={'mb24 p12'}>
      <div>{getDiagnosticReports(patientInfo)}</div>
    </section>
  )
}

export default SimpleDiagnosticReports
